title: Problems importing my saved passwords from Chrome to Firefox and syncing them
content:
I currently use Chrome on Android & Chromebook as my main browser, but I would like to switch to using Firefox now. To do this, I need to import my passwords from Chrome to Firefox, and have them sync between the Firefoxes on all 3 of my devices, but it's not working. I have tried the following:

Method 1: I installed Chrome on my new Linux machine. Checked and made sure it had synced my passwords by logging into a website using Chrome. Then, on Firefox, I pressed alt to enable the toolbar, then File->Import from another browser. The pop-up says "No programs that contain bookmarks, history, or password data could be found."

Method 2: Chrome seems to have a feature to export the passwords to csv. So I exported the passwords from Chrome to a csv on Linux. To be thorough (because I am having trouble getting this to work), I used accounts.firefox.com to sign out the Firefox on my android phone and chromebook, then (on the phone) I deleted my browsing data, uninstalled firefox, and rebooted the phone. Back on Linux, I did about:config, then set signon.management.page.fileImport.enabled to true, then did about:logins then menu->"import from a file", selected the csv that I just exported from Chrome, and clicked Import. Import Complete, 332 logins added, 1 not added because it was missing a password. Logins successfully imported, hooray! For testing purposes, I create a unique new password entry, http://foo.com username "a" password "b". Then I go to about:preferences, make sure that syncing is on and I'm currently syncing logins and passwords, and press "sync now". Log in to my phone, install Firefox from the play store, start it up, sign in using my email and password (it says "syncing"), go to logins and passwords, click "saved logins". The only one listed is for foo.com, the fake one I created to test the syncing, but I expected to see all 333 there.

How do I get this to work?
creator: jbayes

title: Il browser è entrato in loop e non è più utilizzabile.
content:
Oggi, di punto in bianco, mentre stavo effettuando delle ricerche per motivi professionali, Firefox mi ha "abbandonato" nel senso che nella barra degli indirizzi è comparso il seguente URL:

http://www1.cdnsure.com/?tm=1&subid4=1677516412.0412550000&KW1=CloudFlare%20CDN&KW2=Content%20Delivery%20Network%20CDN%20Services&KW3=CDN%20Video%20Provider&searchbox=0&domainname=0&backfill=0

Il browser è entrato in una specie di loop, continuando a caricare, ogni 2/3 secondi sempre la stessa pagina a cui fa riferimento l'indirizzo sopra riportato. Ho provato a disinstallare Firefox ed a pulire il file di registro, sia tramite CCleaner sia manualmente ed ho provveduto a reinstallare nuovamente Firefox. Ho eseguito un reboot del mio Pc, prima d'utilizzare nuovamente il browser però il problema non l'ho risolto affatto e questo è molto seccante sia perché Firefox è più "evoluto" di altri browser (tipo Opera o Google Chrome) sia perché alcune delle mie applicazioni sono collegate a Firefox, soprattutto quelle "aziendali". Più sotto allego la schermata che mi compare.

Qualcuno può darmi qualche "dritta" in merito, per tentare di risolvere questo problema? Ringrazio sin da ora chi vorrà illuminarmi in merito a questa "faccenda".

title: Problems with Firefox
content:
Hi, I am trying to convert from MS Edge to Firefox as my main browser and I am having two problems.

Firefox will not import Favorites from Edge to Bookmarks in Firefox. I have tried several times using the Manage Bookmarks dialog box and then Import and Backup. Each time I have checked the Edge and Favorites import boxes and the next dialog box says favorites are imported but all that imports are the favorites from the Favorites Bar from Edge. When I click on the Show your Bookmarks (Star with Bracket underneath) there is no indication, except for the favorites from the Favorites Bar in Edge that any bookmarks have been imported from Edge. The other problem is when I bring up the login screen from my bank, the field for the password will not let me put the cursor in the box, therefore I cannot logon to my bank. When I bring up my bank logon page on Edge, there is no problem putting my password into the password field. The field is not grayed out in Firefox but it will not let me access this field with the cursor.

Please advise so I can fully transfer my browser over from Edge to Firefox. I am computer literate so I have followed all instructions. Thanks, Gary

title: what's the benefit of having a primary password set?
content:
Hi all,

this is not about a bug, I'd simply like to make sure I'm not missing anything trivial here...

When opening pages that use credentials stored in password manager I've noticed very often the password field on that page offers an "eye" icon to show the password. I can click on it and the password is shown in clear immediately. OTOH, if I'd like to view the same stored credentials in password manager I always have to enter the primary password.

So, I'm wondering why the "eye" icon is giving away such sensitive information so easily, as all an "intruder" needs to do is using my browser to open any login page that has credentials stored in my password manager and will not be prompted for a password.

Is there some setting to prevent this? Am I missing something fundamental here? Thanks for any comments.

Cheers, Chris

title: Possible https handshake issue with multiple sites
content:
I have issue with Firefox with multiple sites that hang up in https handshake phase and you cannot access to site with windows 11 and firefox.

For example this site wont open up with firefox but open up with every other browser just fine: https://www.verkkokauppa.com/

All diagnostic data collected from ping and tracers show that there are not any network issues in internet connection all data I have collected suggest that this issue is happening on the application layer and is issue in Firefox browser or some other reason handshake phase stucks.It feels like Firefox won't go through TLS/SSL handshake phase and gets stuck in this phase forever without opening up an HTTPS connection with the site. This issue happens even when I try to use Firefox in troubleshoot mode and turn off all extensions. Disabling antivirus and firewall doesn't help either.

Is there some known issue with handshake code of firefox (especially in windows 11)? This issue seem to only happening in Windows 11 and firefox when I try latest firefox in linux or mobile android versions this issue is not happening.

title: Firefox kan pludslig ikke anvendes på MitID  The Firefox browser suddenly cannot be used for MitID
content:
Firefox browser kan pludselig ikke bruges til MitID - MitID siger at det er en teknisk fejl hos Firefox - og jeg skulle kontakte jer og spørge hvornår i får det lavet ? Jeg ønsker ikke at bruge hverken Chrome eller Egde da jeg er super tilfreds med Firefox.

MitId Skriver : Dear Sanne Thank you for your inquiry. We are still waiting for Firefox to resolve this error. Since we are not part of Firefox, we have no way to fix the error. As support, we can only recommend that you try to use a different browser. If you don't want this, you have to wait for Firefox to fix the error.

The Firefox browser suddenly cannot be used for MitID - MitID says that it is a technical error with Firefox - and I should contact you and ask when you will have it fixed? I don't want to use either Chrome or Egde as I am super happy with Firefox.

When will it be fixed ?

Regards Sanne Gutkin mail@sannegutkin.dk
creator: mail1657

title: Bookmarks in toolbar folders not refreshing
content:
Hi, 

Using Macos on an M1 MacBook Pro. When adding bookmarks to folders on version 110 to the bookmarks toolbar the contents of the folders on the toolbar do not update after adding a bookmark.

To clarify, a bookmark can be seen when I click manage bookmarks and look at the same folder (so it is there), it can also be seen if I add a bookmark directly to the bookmarks toolbar root, but not if it's in a folder in the toolbar.

Even a restart of Firefox fails to show the bookmark.

I do have bookmarks in folders on the toolbar but it seems to have stopped showing any new ones.

Any idea why?
creator: TheBR

title: Keyboard shortcut for private mode not working
content:
Hi,

I am using Firefox (v111.0) on a Mac, and I can't seem to get the keyboard shortcut (shift+command+p) to open a private window to work. Things that I've tried:

  • going to menu, and manually clicking New Private Window -> will successfully open a new private window
  • opening firefox in safe more to see if any of my extensions are affecting the keyboard shortcut -> shortcut still doesn't work
  • other keyboard shortcuts such as command+P, shift+command+A, etc. all work.

title: secure connecdtion fails for ALL financial sites
content:
Recently, Firefox cannot establish a secure connection to any financial sites I frequently visit. This includes Wells Fargo, Citibank, Synchronicity, and Fidelity. I don't need help reading what a secure connection failure notice means. I've read it ad there is no help for how to solve it, except to contact the website owner. Since this effects all financial sites I've tried, I don't see how the sites could be the problem or it would be a massive problem and I would be able to find solutions via google search.

The problem is about 1 to 2 weeks old.

I have cleared my browser cookies and cache, as much as i hate to do that, because all my saved other site log-ins are wiped. But I've done it. I'm on the latest version of Firefox. I've turned off my Norton Firewall.

I also cannot connect via Chrome, or Edge. Edge just loaded a second authentication page for Wells Fargo asking my to verify my identity, but the page is blank except for the page name and the company logo. Same thing just happened in the Firefox browser. I can't verify my identity because the page doesn't contain the method to verify. It's blank.

I've also tried requiring SSL in Firefox for all sites.

I'm not finding anything on the web about Norton security creating this problem recently either.
creator: mhemhauser65

title: why are there 14 Firefox processes when I start Firefox
content: why are there 14 processes when I start Firefox? When I kill them all performance speeds up.

title: moving bookmarks from old firefox to new
content: I have been running firefox on my macbook air for years. I just recently upgraded my O.S. to Catalina. I did this primarily because my old firefox would no longer update. I did the upgrade to Catalina then downloaded "new" firefox. I have both "versions" of firefox available. the old one with all my bookmarks etc. and the new one with nothing. I hit move bookmarks on the new version but the only options were from chrome or safari. How can I move over the bookmarks to the new one. Thanks

title: "Bookmarks Toolbar" problem
content:
I have been dealing with an annoying problem after the latest update. I have some folders with multiple addresses on my "Bookmarks Toolbar" to check out some sites and accounts daily (Figure 1). Each folder contains more than one page (Figure 2) of bookmarks and I scroll down to open 10-12 addresses each time (Figure 2/3).

Before the update, there wasn't any problem and when I came back to the folder I could continue from my latest position (on that folder), the positions of the folders reset when I close firefox, but now after some seconds it jumps to the top of the folder and each time I have to scroll down and open some links very fast and while I try to open as much link as l can, it jumps to the top of the folder, It waste my time and energy.
creator: Shpd

title: VERY slow printing of multi-page PDF files
content: I have not had any problems printing PDFs from Firefox until changing last week to Win 11 and Firefox 110. Now there is a pause of nearly half a minute between each sheet when printing multi-page PDF files. This is not a problem with the URLs (the files are local), and not a general printer problem since the same files print fine with Adobe Reader. I'm not sure what has changed (size of some cache?), but any way of going back to the previous smooth printing would be very much appreciated.
creator: map65
